alert.note: Alert for Columbus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:32PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brunswick and south central Columbus Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Iredell, or near Little River, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oak Island, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Yaupon Beach, Ocean Crest Pier, Iredell, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Carolina Shores, Calabash, Civie Town, Grissettown, Supply, Longwood, Seaside, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Russtown and Pireway. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
